w:r.w:t: A play on the environment for K-2nd graders
graders understand waste Reuse (creatively reusing items you may have thrown out, holding yard sales, bringing things to Good Will)
graders understand waste Reduction (replacing paper products with more permanent ones, buying bigger amounts of things, purchasing items with less packaging)
To include interaction between the children in the audience and the actors on stage that assures students are engaged in learning the “3 Rs”
To explain landfills and give reasons why the “3 Rs” should be practiced
: most everyone is a bother to

recycle bin, garbage can, and organics bin.
! I’m Pippi, the puppy! You want to know a secret? I have a special super-power.
And, it’s not that I can talk.
All of the animals here can talk—at least to each other. My super-power is so special that even Stevie, my person, doesn’t know what it is.
know, but you will…watch and wait!

sake! The plastic bag the rice comes in just broke and now there’s rice all over everything. As if I didn’t already have enough to do.

piles of trash just lying there waiting to get buried. Waiting to rot. Stinking up the planet. Heating things up.

Stevie, Gramma and Auntie Heather and Brittany are here.
Why don’t you and Pippi come in now.
This is your best birthday ever, huh, Mom?
Yes, sweetie, the best birthday ever. Oh my, and after the party we’re going to clean up the mess in this yard.
